docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 16 -- Two Argentine destroyers were attacked by pro-Peron planes this morning. The ships arrived here tonight with five men dead and thirty-two wounded.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 16 -- Two Argentine destroyers were attacked by pro-Peron planes this morning. The ships arrived here tonight with five men dead and thirty-two wounded.
docs.abstract: destroyers Cervantes and Rioja, attacked by Govt planes off BA, arrive in Montevideo with 5 dead, 32 hurt; Cervantes crew to be interned; ships were carrying rebels to BA from Rio Santiago

headline.main: PERONIST PLANES BOMB 2 WARSHIPS; 5 Are Killed and 32 Wounded on Destroyers, Which Then Put In at Montevideo

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 17 -- once more Latin-American countries find themselves caught in a trade trap devised by foreign totalitarian states.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 17 -- President Juan D. Peron's "forces of repression" announced tonight that they had "liberated" Cordoba, provisional capital and key base of the rebel government.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 17 -- President Juan D. Peron's "forces of repression" announced tonight that they had "liberated" Cordoba, provisional capital and key base of the rebel government.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 18 -- The Government of President Juan D. Peron in effect appealed to the rebels tonight to refrain from bombing Buenos Aires.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 18 -- The Government of President Juan D. Peron in effect appealed to the rebels tonight to refrain from bombing Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: Govt in ef fect urges rebels not to bomb Buenos Aires; Peron situation seen serious

headline.main: CALL IT OPEN CITY; Attack on Buenos Aires Threatened Unless President Quits PERONISTS PLEAD WITH INSURGENTS

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept 18 -- The General Confederation of Labor called upon its members today to join the struggle against the rebel forces and to live up to the unions' often-shouted slogan, "Our lives for Peron."
